Filter files by timeline segment duty cycle

filter_files_by_dutycycle.Rd

This internal utility checks whether data files (with GPS start times and durations) are covered by timeline segments with a sufficient duty cycle. It can operate with or without an explicit `detector` column in the segment table.

Usage

filter_files_by_dutycycle(
  files_df,
  segs_df,
  duty.cycle.lwr = 95,
  require_full_coverage = TRUE
)

Arguments

files_df

A `data.frame` with at least the columns:

  • GPSstart (numeric/integer): GPS start time of the file

  • duration (numeric/integer): file length in seconds

  • detector (character): detector identifier

  • url (character): file URL

Typically produced by get_segment().

segs_df

A `data.frame` with at least the columns:

  • start, stop: GPS start and stop times of the segment

  • duty_cycle (numeric, optional): duty cycle in percent; if missing, added with NA.

  • detector (character, optional): if absent, all files are matched to the same segments.

Typically produced by get_timeline_segments().

duty.cycle.lwr

Numeric scalar. Lower threshold for duty cycle (in the same units as segs_df$duty_cycle, e.g. 95 for 95%). Defaults to 95.

require_full_coverage

Logical. If TRUE, the file interval [GPSstart, GPSstart + duration) must be entirely contained within a segment. If FALSE, partial overlap is sufficient.

Value

A subset of files_df retaining only the rows that pass the duty cycle and coverage check. If no file passes, an empty data.frame with the same columns is returned.

Details

For each file interval, the function finds all covering segments in segs_df (according to require_full_coverage). If multiple segments overlap, the maximum duty cycle among them is compared against duty.cycle.lwr. Files covered only by segments with NA duty cycle are rejected.

See also

get_segment, get_timeline
